availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Residence: Whitstone, Whitley County, KY. A farmer. Born in Greene County, Tennessee, son of Robert Jacob Stinson and Mary S. Arter. Married Susan Elizabeth Wells. Father of Jacob Stinson, Robert Stinson, Perry Stinson, Mary Caroline (Stinson) Perkins, Nancy Sylvania (Stinson) Johnson, Mary Polly (Stinson) Sullivan, Irene (Stinson) Sullivan, James Stinson, Aaron Stinson, Amelia (Stinson) Chaney, and Abner Madison Stinson.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Whitley County, Whitstone, p. 31.

Find A Grave, Entry for Jacob Stinson (1800-1884), Find A Grave Memorial # 45099886, Stinson-Sullivan-Hays Cemetery, Whitley County, Kentucky, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=stinson&GSfn=jacob&GSby=1800&GSbyrel=in&GSdyrel=all&GSob=n&GRid=45099886&df=all& (accessed 24 June 2017).
